oai_dc:dc.dc:title: French. Lizzie Crozier French Scrapbook, p. 46 a
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Lizzie Crozier French Scrapbook, p. 46 a. Newspaper clipping: Nearly 18,000 Are Registered.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Politics & government; Clippings; Scrapbooks; Women; Voter registration;
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: C.M. McClung Historical Collection, Knox County Public Library
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: For information on license and use fees and acquiring high-resolution image files, contact DigitalCollections@knoxlib.org or phone 865 215-8814. Please provide a brief description of the material.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: NEARLY 18,000 ARE REGISTERED Half as Many Women as Men Reported, Books Close at 9 O'Clock Tonight Despite the fact that today is the last day of the biennial registration, the books closing tonight at 9 o'clock, only about 100 more women and 126 more men had registered up until noon today than had registered when the books were closed last night at 9 o'clock, according to reports from each of the precincts. Up until noon today reports show: Men registered, 11,663; women registered, 5,898; total, 17,561. In order to vote in the municipal elections or the constitutional convention election, citizens must have registration certificates of the present general registration. It has been suggested that the rain of this morning was partly responsible for the light registration for the half day and that the afternoon would see from 600 to 800 additional registrations.
